text:
*Let’s talk LinkedIn!* 
Hey B2B content pals! I work for a <https://www.getleeway.com/en|legal tech startup> and LinkedIn is proving to be a great channel channel for us. Let’s talk LinkedIn strategies, tactics, tips, types of content, algorithm, free courses, podcasts etc all around LinkedIn. It’d also be great to hear what’s worked well and not so well for you in the past:point_down: Thanks in advance for sharing!

elements.text: Let’s talk LinkedIn!
Hey B2B content pals! I work for a
legal tech startup

and LinkedIn is proving to be a great channel channel for us. Let’s talk LinkedIn strategies, tactics, tips, types of content, algorithm, free courses, podcasts etc all around LinkedIn. It’d also be great to hear what’s worked well and not so well for you in the past
Thanks in advance for sharing!

text: Thank you both! I'll shoot you both a DM

elements.text: Thank you both! I'll shoot you both a DM

text:
I've been wanting to talk about this, too!

I own an SEO/content agency and have been dipping my toe in LinkedIn a bit.

I haven't nailed anything particularly effective for our business pages, but I feel like I'm beginning to get the hang of what works for my personal brand (which seems to be what other people do that performs well).

The kinds of content I've had perform well are:

• leadership-centric content (how I work with employees, general leadership advice from my own experiences, etc.)
• surprising tips from my industry (in this case, SEO)
• personal stories (my post about adopting my son is still my best ever)
• posts with a GIF
• text-only posts
• polls
• posts w/5 popular hashtags (that part took a bit of research)
I've stopped using almost any images other than GIFs because they perform so badly. Also, I think that (like Facebook) LinkedIn shows a link post to fewer people. I see most people putting links in the first comment when mentioning anything off-site.

I've been looking into <https://www.shieldapp.ai/|SHIELD> to track my analytics.  I also bought <https://jordannelson.podia.com/courses/19-tips-grow-a-small-account/870658-welcome/2577769-introduction|this $1 mini-course> on LinkedIn about how to grow a small account, which I haven't taken yet but hopefully will help. :slightly_smiling_face:

attachments.title: Shield Analytics | Your LinkedIn analytics tool
attachments.text: Your data. Your personal brand. Get LinkedIn analytics for your personal LinkedIn profile. For you, your team, or your agency and clients. Measure content and profile performance in one dashboard.
attachments.fallback: Shield Analytics | Your LinkedIn analytics tool

attachments.title: Introduction
attachments.text: linkedin course, linkedin cohort, leverage linkedin make money, jordan nelson, linkedin

text:
Hi all,
I hope this is the right channel! I'm working with a client in the Medical reusable textile industry. We have a full team behind the project: SEO, PPC, Social (paid and organic), and email marketing. Our VP of sales has tasked us with ideation for using an allotted amount of money we were initially going to use for a photoshoot. At this point, I feel like I'm banging my head against a wall. Does anyone have any great links to LinkedIn strategies or out-of-the-box ideas to drive traffic?

elements.text:

Does anyone have any great links to LinkedIn strategies or out-of-the-box ideas to drive traffic?

text: LinkedIn question: LinkedIn lets you post articles. Is there any benefit in writing an article and linking to it in a post vs. publishing the article on your blog or wherever? Does LinkedIn favour posts with links to articles on its platform?

elements.text: LinkedIn question: LinkedIn lets you post articles. Is there any benefit in writing an article and linking to it in a post vs. publishing the article on your blog or wherever? Does LinkedIn favour posts with links to articles on its platform?

text:
For the SaaS startup I work at, we've also used a *PDF document as a carousel post*, and that has received a lot of engagement/impressions.

Otherwise, I am trying to have our Founder/employees post more as the engagement is higher on their posts than the business page.

, and that has received a lot of engagement/impressions.

text: <@U02333AMCUW> I can also vouch for GIFs! One of our best performing posts too (over 1200 reactions and 50+ comments)!

elements.text: I can also vouch for GIFs! One of our best performing posts too (over 1200 reactions and 50+ comments)!

text: <@U02333AMCUW> One of the challenges I’ve found with business pages is that they’re an afterthought compared to personal pages. Many of them have far fewer followers, so your strategy of posting on founder/employee pages makes sense to me.

elements.text: One of the challenges I’ve found with business pages is that they’re an afterthought compared to personal pages. Many of them have far fewer followers, so your strategy of posting on founder/employee pages makes sense to me.

text: <@U02333AMCUW> I agree! We’re trying something similar. If you’re helping them write the posts, do you ever have various employees posting the same thing? We’ve done this as the team need some support but it sometimes doesn’t feel quite right to me :thinking_face: How do you approach it?

elements.text: I agree! We’re trying something similar. If you’re helping them write the posts, do you ever have various employees posting the same thing? We’ve done this as the team need some support but it sometimes doesn’t feel quite right to me
How do you approach it?

text: <@U024W153DNH> LinkedIn is about personal connections, so I find people like interacting with other people rather than pages. Bigger companies with good content use their pages like a "yearbook" featuring the latest product/feature releases, company news or employee highlights. I find that employee highlights on company pages always do well because (of course) they feature people!

elements.text: LinkedIn is about personal connections, so I find people like interacting with other people rather than pages. Bigger companies with good content use their pages like a "yearbook" featuring the latest product/feature releases, company news or employee highlights. I find that employee highlights on company pages always do well because (of course) they feature people!

text: <@U02333AMCUW> Yes :100: But it still surprises some companies when they try to use their business page and don’t get much action. Takes time and a concerted effort.

elements.text: Yes
But it still surprises some companies when they try to use their business page and don’t get much action. Takes time and a concerted effort.

text:
<@U02ANC57AAY> I'm trying to build the Founder's and the personal brands of executive leadership. For them, I'd write the post or give some guidance. For the rest of the employees, I encourage them to reshare the company post and they'll usually write 1 sentence. It's easier for employees to reshare posts that are related to a client they manage or fun company update.

I've been wanting to try the employee advocacy feature within the LinkedIn business page, but haven't yet. Have you tried it?

elements.text:

I've been wanting to try the employee advocacy feature within the LinkedIn business page, but haven't yet. Have you tried it?

text: <@U024W153DNH> So true about the concerted effort! I've talked to some founders of CPG brands or agencies and they often use their own personal page as the "company marketing page". The content is a mixture of their own creation / relying on a content person on the team to produce it.

elements.text: So true about the concerted effort! I've talked to some founders of CPG brands or agencies and they often use their own personal page as the "company marketing page". The content is a mixture of their own creation / relying on a content person on the team to produce it.

text: Yeah, but if you blow up traffic and conversions are down, will they be happy? I think sometimes they say traffic and they really want something much more specific.

elements.text: Yeah, but if you blow up traffic and conversions are down, will they be happy? I think sometimes they say traffic and they really want something much more specific.

text: For LinkedIn, if you have a sales team, you want conversational ads with a STELLAR offer into a call flow.

elements.text: For LinkedIn, if you have a sales team, you want conversational ads with a STELLAR offer into a call flow.

text:
Good topic <@U02ANC57AAY>! Interesting to read everyone's comments here.

I've been posting consistently as part of a 28-day Linkedin challenge/program I'm doing.

As a group, we've noticed that:
• Polls are performing the best for organic reach right now. Then text-only and PDF/carousel uploads. 
• Videos get low engagement but are good for building brand awareness and showing personality. 
• Images don't get much reach.
• Linkedin prefers users don't direct other users off of their site, so including external links in status updates will result in low/zero reach. (As a user I'm also not a fan of having to click a link to go off the platform to consume someone's content. Just give me the good stuff directly where I already am!)
• Resharing posts from company pages to personal profiles isn't getting nearly as much reach as individuals posting directly to their own profiles. 
• Don't forget engagement + relationships. Actively commenting on other people's updates and having conversations via DMs is where the real magic happens. 
If you want to learn more about the challenge refer <https://bit.ly/3fRPSHm|here>. It's hosted by String Nguyen (The Trusted Voice). She's a 4-time Linkedin Voice. The next round kicks off on 23 August.

attachments.title: TTV28: 28 Days of LinkedIn Content Challenge by The Trusted Voice
attachments.text: Join TTV28: a 28 Day LinkedIn Content Challenge - gain visibility and amplify your voice on LinkedIn
attachments.fallback: TTV28: 28 Days of LinkedIn Content Challenge by The Trusted Voice

elements.text: Good topic

! Interesting to read everyone's comments here.

I've been posting consistently as part of a 28-day Linkedin challenge/program I'm doing.

As a group, we've noticed that:
Polls are performing the best for organic reach right now. Then text-only and PDF/carousel uploads.
Videos get low engagement but are good for building brand awareness and showing personality.
Images don't get much reach.

Linkedin prefers users don't direct other users off of their site, so including external links in status updates will result in low/zero reach. (As a user I'm also not a fan of having to click a link to go off the platform to consume someone's content. Just give me the good stuff directly where I already am!)
Resharing posts from company pages to personal profiles isn't getting nearly as much reach as individuals posting directly to their own profiles.
Don't forget engagement + relationships. Actively commenting on other people's updates and having conversations via DMs is where the real magic happens.
If you want to learn more about the challenge refer
here
. It's hosted by String Nguyen (The Trusted Voice). She's a 4-time Linkedin Voice. The next round kicks off on 23 August.
